data.text: @KellyRH312 @CNNPolitics Well then they should use their bigger voice to unite the country instead of trying to divide it like the terrorist democrats do and push it into a civil war ...Trust me its coming ..

@DunlapMarcy @KellyRH312 @CNNPolitics They have taken it to a new level of disrespect ..It's 1 thing to disagree with an elected politician but it is another to insult and slander a sitting President as a USA CITIZEN on a worldwide televised event..They show the world why the USA is ripe for a civil war if anything..
@CNNPolitics Just shut up and entertain

@KellyRH312 @CNNPolitics Freedom of speech I agree...However  the country can do without all the disrespectful comments about the President ...They are only causing more division in the USA and we already have the Democrat party that has always done that ..
@Newday50 @CNNPolitics No one ☺️🇺🇸
@CNNPolitics I actually though the politics were pretty subdued.
@CNNPolitics Of course there were politics, Comrade Kimmel was hosting.
@TweetsFromTonya @CNNPolitics I'm sure there are a few, there was Charleston Heston...
@BerkeleyHunt4 @CNNPolitics I call false on this. As citizens we are allowed to speak our minds and have ppl disagree. Difference between them and us? Their audience.

@PotterOnPoltics @CNNPolitics You are opposed to any citizen who has a different opinion than you? They have the same rights as we do for speaking out. Difference is, their audience is larger than ours.
@Newday50 @CNNPolitics They are citizens like you and I. They just have a bigger voice. Why do you dislike the fact that they speak out?

@CNNPolitics Are they not citizens? Do they not vote? Do they have children or grandkids in school? I'm very glad for their voices, for their activism, and for their love of a country that allows their voices to be heard! Thank you #HollywoodActors!!
